page.title: 19BRIDGEWATER CANAL
page.content: THE{BRIDGEWATER CANAL}WAS COMPLETED IN{1761.}IT RUNS EAST-WEST ACROSS THE STUDY AREA. ORIGINALLY IT WAS USED TO TRANSPORT COAL FROM THE LOCAL {COLLIERIES}TO THE{INDUSTRIAL CENTRES, LIKE{MANCHESTER.}NOW MOST OF THE COLLIERIES ARE CLOSED AND THE CANAL IS MAINLY USED FOR{PLEASURE BOATING. THERE IS STILL EVIDENCE OF COAL HAVING BEEN TIPPED INTO THE BARGES, AND IN PARTS THE CANAL IS MUCH WIDER TO ALLOW FOR THE TURNING OF THESE BOATS. IN PLACES{REPAIR WORK}HAS HAD TO BE UNDERTAKEN TO MAINTAIN THE{CANAL BANK. IN SOME PLACES THERE ARE{NEW SIDE {BANKINGS}AND{NUMEROUS SAPLINGS}OF DIFFERENT SPECIES HAVE BEEN PLANTED. THERE ARE ALSO{PICNIC TABLES,}LITTER BINS AND A{NEW PATH}MADE OUT OF GRAVEL.
